content.user_title: Extract Structured Data with Cohere v2
content.value_statement: Building data extraction pipelines with LLMs requires consistent, validated JSON outputs. This skill provides expert guidance on using Cohere v2 JSON Schema mode for reliable entity extraction, classification, and structured data pipelines.
actual_capabilities: Initialize Cohere v2 Chat Client with Python SDK
Configure JSON Schema mode for validated structured outputs
Extract entities (people, organizations, locations, dates) from text
Build classification systems using enum constraints
Design nested schemas with $ref for reusable structures
Create production pipelines for batch document processing
limitations: RAG not supported in JSON Schema mode
Schema mode adds initial latency overhead
Numeric ranges and array length constraints not supported

best_practices: Define required fields in every schema to ensure essential data is always extracted
Use enum constraints for classification to guarantee valid category values
Reuse schemas across multiple requests to benefit from caching and reduce latency
anti_patterns: Using JSON mode without explicit schema enforcement when structured output is needed
Missing the required array in schema definition causes API errors
Not wrapping JSON parsing in try-except blocks for production resilience

faq.question: What models support JSON Schema mode?
faq.answer: command-a-03-2025 and newer models support structured outputs with JSON Schema mode enforcement.

faq.question: What are the schema field limits?
faq.answer: No explicit limit for response_format schemas. Tools mode supports maximum 200 fields across all tools.

faq.question: Can I use RAG with structured outputs?
faq.answer: RAG is not supported when using JSON Schema mode. Use basic JSON mode or standard chat for RAG scenarios.

faq.question: Is my data sent to third parties?
faq.answer: Data is sent to Cohere API for processing. Review Cohere privacy policy for data handling details.

faq.question: Why does first request take longer?
faq.answer: Initial request incurs schema processing overhead. Subsequent requests use cached schemas for faster responses.

faq.question: How does this compare to OpenAI structured outputs?
faq.answer: Both enforce schema compliance, but Cohere uses JSON Schema format while OpenAI uses JSON Schema with slight variations.
